description: Learned borrowing from Latin vulva, earlier volva (“womb, female sexual organ”), probably from volvō (“to turn, wrap around”). Akin to Sanskrit उल्ब (úlba, “womb”).

nouns.description: vulva (plural vulvas or vulvae or vulvæ)

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The external female sexual organs, collectively.
(biology) A protrusion on the side of a nematode.
